doc.title: Innovent Biologics (1801.HK): Earnings review: Expect higher FY profit with 1H beat; first ph3 MRCT to accelerate IB1363 development
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS/Innovent Biologics 1801.HK Earnings Review Expect higher FY profit with 1H beat first ph3 MRCT to accelerate IBI363 deve_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS

passages.text: Higher profit with deepening operating efficiency: 1H25 revenues of Rmb5.95bn (+51% y/y, vs. GSe Rmb5.94bn) were in- line, with 1) Rmb5.2bn of product sales (+37% y/y, as disclosed in early August, see our note) driven by the expanding commercial franchise (16 products in total), particularly the growing General Medicines portfolio, with the sales ramp- up of mazdutide to be the key growth driver in 2H25 and beyond; and 2) license income of Rmb666mn, primarily from the US \(\) 80\mathrm{mn}\$ upfront payment from the DLL3 ADC deal with Roche. Net profit of Rmb834mn grew higher (vs. Rmb- 393mn/Rmb298mn in 1H/2H24, or GSe Rmb299mn), attributed to 1) improving GPM of 86.0% (or 84.1% for product GPM, +185bp y/y) with increasing production volume coupled with ongoing optimization in manufacturing efficiency (140kL of manufacturing capacity in use), 2) lower- than- expected R&D spending of Rmb1bn (-28% y/y, vs. GSe Rmb1.35bn), which we view as temporary as eleven ph3 trials have either initiated in 1H or in planning, particularly the MRCT (e.g. ph3 in late- line sq- NSCLC/CRC for IB1363, ph3 in 3L PDAC/GC for IB1343), and 3) managed growth in SG&A spending of Rmb3.37bn (+29% y/y, vs. GSe Rmb3.47bn) with the expanding team in General Medicines (1,000 FTEs in commercial team). With non- IFRS EBITDA of Rmb1.4bn (or c.Rmb840mn excluding upfront payment from the DLL3 ADC deal), mgmt expect to have better bottom line performance for FY25 (vs. previous goal to reach EBITDA break- even), and we expect GAAP level profit of Rmb924mn for the full year.

First ph3 MRCT for IB1363 to accelerate global innovation: As the potential next- generation IO cornerstone for Innovent's "IO+ADC" strategy (see our R&D day takeaway), IB1363 (PD- 1/IL2- q- bias BsAb) is progressing into global ph3 stage, with the recent IND clearance by FDA to start the first global ph3 trial, which in our view officially kicking off Innovent's journey of global clinical development. The trial is designed as a full- size ph3 MRCT in many aspects, with 1) IO- resistant squamous NSCLC as the target indication, for which IB1363 showed competitive efficacy across ORR/PFS/OS at ASCQ2025, 2) randomized controlled groups with IB1363 (3mg/kg Q3W, N=300) and docetaxel (75mg/m2 Q3W, N=300), 3) patient enrollment planned across major global regions, including China, US, Canada, EU, UK, and Japan, and 4) OS as the primary endpoint, and PFS/ORR/DOR as secondary endpoint. In addition, Innovent progressing quickly for other indications, with 1) the next ph3 trial in plan (for 3MSS CRC), 2) ph1b/2 POC trials initiated in early- line treatment (e.g. 1L

CRC, 1L/neoadjuvant setting for NSCLC) with lower dosage (1.5mg/kg), and 3) broader exploration in EGFRm NSCLC, PROC, and more. With six assets approved for trials in US, mgmt shared the need to build a capable product development team in key global regions (particularly in US), to support the global innovation.

Positive initial market observation for mazdutide: Approved in late June, mazdutide was launched with multi- channel strategy together with customer- facing marketing campaigns that are distinctive to traditional marketing events targeting physicians. Mgmt shared the two key focuses during the early period: 1) raise the awareness of weight management in community, and build positive branding of mazdutide highlighting its broad metabolic benefits (e.g. liver fat reduction, LDL), and 2) ensure product accessibility, with multi- channel coverage (hospitals, retail/online pharmacies, community clinics etc.) through both in- house team and partners. Mgmt shared that the initial market observation has been positive, in both user feedbacks and sales ramp- up trend. Two new ph3 trials were initiated for indication expansion in MAFLD and OSA, which could further differentiate the drug profile of mazdutide among other GLP- 1 drugs.

Valuation and target price: Our updated DCF- based 12m TP is HK\$103.22 (from prev. HK\$98.23). We update our 2025- 27E EPS estimates from Rmb0.43/Rmb2.79/Rmb2.69 to Rmb0.54/Rmb2.73/Rmb2.62 to reflect 1) 2H24 financials, 2) our fine- tuned estimates on near- term operating expenses; and 3) increased POS of IB1363 in IO- resistant squamous NSCLC (from 51% to 67%) given the improved visibility on ph3 MRCT. Key risks include: 1) Intensifying competition in the PD- 1/L1 market in China; 2) uncertain approval timeline for key candidates; 3) potential restrictions on off- label use arising from any safety issues; and 4) failure of R&D projects.

Innovent Biologics is a leading China- based biopharma company with a strong presence in immuno- oncology and growing assets in autoimmune/metabolic/ophthalmology. The company has a deep pipeline of \(30+\) assets built via in- house R&D and collaboration with global partners, including commercialized products led by sintilimab (the leading PD- 1 inhibitor covering major indications in the NRDL). We believe Innovent will continue its leading position in China biotech with: 1) deep pipeline of novel molecules targeting next- generation I/O targets with encouraging preliminary data (e.g., IB1363 (PD- 1/IL2- bais BsAb) with a differentiated drug profile in IO- treated / cold tumors, IB1362 (GLP- 1/GCCR) with encouraging efficacy in obesity/diabetes); 2) strong commercialization capabilities as best demonstrated in the quick ramp- up of sintilimab; and 3) its deep collaboration with global partners, especially Eli Lilly. We consider Innovent as undervalued at current levels given the high value of market- implied WACC (12%) only reflecting the value of its de- risked indications and not fully pricing in its strong revenue and pipeline. We are Buy rated on the stock. Key risks include: 1) Intensifying competition in the PD- 1/L1 market in China; 2) uncertain approval timeline for key candidates; 3) potential restrictions on off- label use arising from any safety issues; and 4) failure of R&D projects.
the PD- 1/L1 market in China; 2) uncertain approval timeline for key candidates; 3) potential restrictions on off- label use arising from any safety issues; and 4) failure of R&D projects.
Source: Company data, Goldman Sachs Research estimates, FactSet. Price as of 27 Aug 2025 close.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

Early- Stage Biotech (ES). Goldman Sachs has suspended coverage of this company. Not Covered (NC). Goldman Sachs does not cover this company.
